meanings.sent1: She decided to degame the old board by taking out all the colorful pieces.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to degame their desks by clearing off all the toys.
meanings.sent3: After the party, they had to degame the living room, picking up all the scattered confetti.
meanings.sent4: The storm degamed the garden, blowing away all the decorations and leaving it bare.
meanings.sent5: He used a special tool to degame the computer, deleting all the unnecessary files.

meanings.definition: To make less fun or enjoyable.
meanings.sent1: The rain degamed our picnic plans, making it less enjoyable.
meanings.sent2: His strict rules degamed the party, making everyone feel bored.
meanings.sent3: Trying to control every detail can sometimes degame the fun of an adventure.
meanings.sent4: The absence of music degamed the dance, leaving the guests unenthusiastic.
meanings.sent5: Too many rules can degame a game, taking away the joy of playing.

meanings.definition: To strip of decoration or ornamentation.
meanings.sent1: The minimalist style degamed the room, removing all unnecessary decorations.
meanings.sent2: She decided to degame the Christmas tree, opting for a simple look this year.
meanings.sent3: The strong wind degamed the house, blowing away all the festive lights.
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to degame the painting, leaving it with a clean, unadorned look.
meanings.sent5: The renovation project aimed to degame the building, giving it a sleek, modern appearance.
